info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell and southwestern Burke Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marion, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Morganton, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, Lake James, Table Rock, South Mountains State Park, Nebo, Pleasant Gardens and Glenwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
